skill.name: skill-i18n
skill.description: Translate SKILL.md and README.md files into multiple languages for sharing skills internationally
skill.summary: Translate SKILL.md and README.md files into multiple languages for sharing skills internationally
skill.author: guo-yu

security_audit.summary: This skill contains ONLY documentation files with no executable code. All 337 static findings are false positives triggered by shell command examples and JSON configuration patterns in markdown documentation. No actual shell execution, cryptographic operations, or malicious behavior exists in this skill.

content.user_title: Translate skill documentation into multiple languages
content.value_statement: This skill translates SKILL.md and README.md files into multiple languages including Chinese, Japanese, Korean, and Spanish. It preserves code blocks and technical terms while adapting natural language content to each locale. Configure once and automatically translate all new skills.
actual_capabilities: Translates SKILL.md and README.md into Chinese, Japanese, Korean, and Spanish
Preserves code blocks, file paths, command names, and technical identifiers
Stores per-skill language preferences in configuration file
Integrates with share-skill for documentation site generation
Supports command-line flags for automated translation workflows
limitations: Requires AI model for actual translation (not a machine translation service)
Does not translate images or binary content
Manual review recommended for technical accuracy in target languages
First run requires interactive language selection

use_cases.title: Publish skills internationally
use_cases.description: Share your skills with non-English speaking users by automatically generating translations

use_cases.title: Maintain multilingual docs
use_cases.description: Keep documentation synchronized across all supported languages with minimal effort

use_cases.title: Enable global skill marketplace
use_cases.description: Support international users with documentation in their native language

output_examples.input: Translate the current skill to Japanese
Translate port-allocator to Chinese and Korean

best_practices: Configure default languages once to avoid repetitive selections
Use the --no-prompt flag in automated workflows and CI/CD pipelines
Review translations for technical accuracy before publishing
anti_patterns: Running translation without reviewing culturally inappropriate content
Manually editing generated translations instead of re-running with fixes
Forgetting to commit translated files alongside source documentation

faq.question: What languages are supported?
faq.answer: Simplified Chinese (zh-CN), Japanese (ja), Korean (ko), and Spanish (es). Custom languages can be added.

faq.question: What files are translated by default?
faq.answer: SKILL.md is translated by default. README.md can be included via configuration or --files flag.

faq.question: Where is configuration stored?
faq.answer: Configuration is stored in ~/.claude/skill-i18n-config.json for global and per-skill settings.

faq.question: Does it overwrite existing translations?
faq.answer: By default, it detects existing files and prompts. Use --overwrite flag to replace them.

faq.question: What content is preserved unchanged?
faq.answer: Code blocks, file paths, command names, variable names, JSON keys, and URLs remain in original form.

faq.question: How does it integrate with share-skill?
faq.answer: share-skill calls skill-i18n with --i18n flag to auto-generate translations for documentation sites.
